page.title: 17COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content: In 1977 the village celebrated the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth 11. A village meeting decided that money left after the celebrations should be used to provide showers in the playing field pavilion.Two years later a committee started to raise more money for showers. In 1980 another committee made plans to build a much bigger building.In September 1984 work on the building of the Community Centre began. It took eight months and it was finished on April 25th. 1985.The Community Centre cost Â£75,000.About eight people helped to build the community centre.Two firms supplied the stone to build the Community Centre: Barham Bros Ltd. gave the Charlton Mackrell quarried stone on the front of the building and S.Morris Ltd. supplied the building blocks.
